column5: Spent the weekend in the bush enjoying the early onset of winter in certain parts of the north, broke trail through some fresh powder and punched a lot of holes on a few lakes that we were lucky enough to be the first ones out onto this season.  Fishing was mostly excellent, as first ice almost always is, and my first landed fish happened to be an absolute beast, and my PB brook trout by a pretty large margin. I am not endorsing widespread safe ice in northern Ontario, don't be an idiot. https://imageshack.com/a/rhbl/1 20171125_142235.mp4
Holy Christ that first one is a beauty specimen! It must have felt pretty good to get back out on the hard water again.
What a great start to the hard water season. Always enjoy your reports and hope to see lots more.
Dang!  Sweet fish.
Lookin good  !! Quite the tank in that first shot!
been following these on the gram...i want ice so bad,...
20.5x13...used an online calculator that put it at 4.3 lbs
Impressive fish Joey. I shared that pic with a few people.. nothing but thumbs up, especially from the local trouters.
That is a real beauty.Nice outing.
Congrats on the new P.B. What a Beau-T! So jealous. Still waiting on some consistently cold nights, first ice specks are what winter is all about.

December into early January is absolutely the best time to be on the ice.  I won't be able to get back out until mid-week next week, so I don't mind this milder weather...keep the early season bite hot ?
Wow ... thats an amazing brookie .... nothing can beat being on a lake all to yourself and catching something like that .....
Wow....have machine, will travel LOL Nice work dude. Those are beauties!!  S.
BOOM! That's a great start to the season!
Great day on the ice for sure Joey!!  Man, I'm jealous! I couldn't see your pics at work because of our firewall, or something.. So I was just able to check them out today.  Great looking fish!
Holy smokes Joey. So jealous. Beauty fishing so far.
Can't seem to be able to open them but they sure sound great. Good going JoeyTier. Be safe out this early boys,,,and girls.
Wow that is amazing.  Pretty colours on those fish! Cheers!
Thanks guys

BEAUTY squaretail! Around K-town we have MILLIMETRES of ice, hooray!!!  But a couple cold nights will help this.  And there are 19 days left in bow season, so maybe I am not quite ready to hit the hard water..........  Doug
